articles.title: Crypto-crasher Do Kwon jailed for 15 years over $40bn UST bust
articles.summary:
Judge said his fraud was on 'epic, generational scale'

Terraform Labs founder Do Kwon will spend 15 years in jail after pleading guilty to committing fraud.…
articles.reasoning: The article details legal and regulatory consequences for corporate fraud and mismanagement in a technology company, directly relating to governance, compliance, and oversight failures.

articles.title: Reddit launches High Court challenge to Australia's social media ban for kids
articles.summary: It said the landmark policy has serious implications for Australians' privacy and political rights.
articles.reasoning: The article discusses legal challenges to a government-imposed social media ban, involving compliance, policy implications, and corporate response, which aligns with IT governance concerns around regulatory adherence and organizational IT policy.

articles.title: Silicon photonics won’t matter ‘anytime soon’ says Broadcom CEO
articles.summary:
Chips ’n’ code giant sitting on $50bn of custom AI accelerator orders, sees more to come

Silicon photonics won’t matter in the datacenter “anytime soon,” according to Broadcom CEO Hock Tan.…
articles.reasoning: The article covers technology adoption decisions (e.g., silicon photonics vs. copper interconnects), infrastructure investments by hyperscale customers, and governance of IT resources in AI datacenters.

articles.title: AI superintelligence is a Silicon Valley fantasy, Ai2 researcher says
articles.summary:
The dream of electric sheep gets a reality check from Moore’s Law

You want artificial general intelligence (AGI)? Current-day processors aren't powerful enough to make it happen and our ability to scale up may soon be coming to an end, argues well-known researcher Tim Dettmers.…
articles.reasoning: The article discusses the computational limits and scaling challenges of AI models, which are fundamentally built on and constrained by underlying algorithms for processing and learning.

articles.title: Disney turns to dark side, licenses IP to OpenAI for videos, images
articles.summary:
Begun, these AI wars have

Amid controversy over its ability to generate content with copyrighted characters, OpenAI has struck a three-year deal with Disney to license more than 200 Disney, Pixar, Marvel, and Star Wars characters for use in Sora videos and ChatGPT Images.…
articles.reasoning: Disney aims to extend storytelling and enhance products through AI, indicating a focus on realizing benefits from technology investments and innovations.
